alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large area of slow moving thunderstorms impacting central and eastern portions of Berkeley County and far upper Charleston County. As much as 2 to 5 inches of rain have fallen in some areas this evening. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Bonneau, Jamestown, Old Santee Canal State Park, Pinopolis, Hampton Plantation State Park, Bethera, Farewell Corner, Limerick, Calestown, Beufordtown, Cordesville, Old Cordesville, Thomas Corner, Wadboo, Stony Landing, Simpson Crossing, Palmerville, Macbeth and Simmonsville.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
